[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Online Registration System (ORS) defines requirements for self-service student registration, secure access, and high system availability while ensuring compliance with authentication policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ORS supports student enrollment, role-based access, administrative controls, and real-time course updates.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ORS integrates with student databases, authentication services, and course catalog systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ORS provides a responsive web UI for students, administrators, and IT support.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ORS operates on cloud-hosted infrastructure with automatic scalability.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ORS utilizes React.js for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, PostgreSQL for data storage, and Redis for caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ORS ensures encrypted data exchange via TLS 1.3 and OAuth 2.0 authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ORS optimizes concurrent student registrations with efficient query processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ORS maintains 24/7 availability with IT and DBA support for issue resolution.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ORS supports cross-browser and mobile-friendly access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ORS links to authentication, course management, and student record systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ORS facilitates student registration, course selection, access control, and administrative oversight.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ORS is designed for students, administrators, and IT teams managing system access and troubleshooting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ORS requires secure authentication, stable network connectivity, and periodic maintenance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ORS depends on authentication services, cloud infrastructure, and secured data transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall authenticate users via OAuth 2.0 and enforce role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide an online self-service registration portal with real-time updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow students to register, modify, or cancel course enrollments while ensuring real-time availability (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enforce access controls, allowing students to manage only their records while administrators have full system privileges (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall maintain 24/7 uptime, providing IT and DBA support for issue resolution (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a structured UI that enables students to complete registration with minimal guidance.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process registration requests with minimal delay and reflect updates instantly.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store student records, registration history, and course schedules.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support cloud deployment with high availability and automatic scaling.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with authentication and data protection policies, ensuring secure access control (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure real-time registration updates and transaction security while minimizing downtime.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Registration workflows, uptime monitoring, and access control shall be tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API references, and security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Best practices for registration, authentication, and data security compliance.
